task.title: Set Paths to Externally Referenced Drawings
task.shortdesc: You can set thesavingpath for the xrefs that are changed after attached to the drawingwhen you selecting a savingpath for the xrefs, three types are provided for you: Full path, Relative path, and No path.

context.p: Full path refers to the path that marked by local disk or network server driver. By default, the path for saving the xref files is a Relative path, but this path lacks flexibility, once the file is changed, the path becomes invalid.

Relative path refers to path assigned by folders including current driver or original drawing file. The user can move the original files among multiple drivers within the folder at the same hierarchy without affecting updating xrefs.
You can't set the relative path in local disk or network server driver. The relative paths for xref original files are assigned as follows:

ul.li: \: Look in the root folder of the host drawing's drive
path: Fromthe folder of the host drawing, follow the specified path
\path: Fromthe root folder, follow the specified path
.\path: Fromthe folder of the host drawing, follow the specified path
..\path: Fromthe folder of the host drawing, move up one folder level and follow the specified path
..\..\path: From the folder of the host drawing, move up two folder levels and follow the specified path

context.p: If you have changed the path that includes the xref drawings, such as moving the file or save it to a different path or disk, then all the relative paths of the xref must be changed individually so as to adapt to the new position of its references.
Specifies the path type of inserting xref as No path, the xref will not save the path information, if you want to search the original file of xref, you can search through the following ways:

ul.li: Search for the current folder of the originaldrawing
Search for the Xrefs File Search Path defined in File tab in Options dialog box.
Search for the start folder assigned by shortcut of Windows applications

context.p: No Path is useful when users want to move their drawings to another or an unknown folder hierarchy.
To change the path for a single external reference

step.cmd: Choose Insert > Xref Manager from the main menu.
Select the external reference whose path you want to change.
In Xref Found At, do one of the following:
Enter a new filename or location.
Click , select the xref under a new path in the Select New Path dialog box that displays, and then click Open.
Choose Save Path, andthen click OK.

result.p: NOTE You cannot recursively reference a drawing fromthe same original drawing.
